name: Harper Lee
bio: Harper Lee was an American novelist best known for her novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird', which deals with the issues of racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South.

name: George Orwell
bio: George Orwell was an English novelist and essayist known for his dystopian novels 'Nineteen Eighty-Four' and 'Animal Farm', which explore themes of totalitarianism, surveillance, and political corruption.

name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
bio: F. Scott Fitzgerald was an American novelist and short story writer known for his depictions of the Jazz Age. His most famous work is 'The Great Gatsby', a novel that explores themes of decadence, idealism, and social upheaval.

name: J.K. Rowling
bio: J.K. Rowling is a British author best known for creating the 'Harry Potter' series, which has become one of the best-selling book series in history. Her books have inspired a generation of readers and have been adapted into a successful film franchise.

name: Jane Austen
bio: Jane Austen was an English novelist known primarily for her six major novels, which interpret, critique, and comment upon the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century. Her works often explore themes of love, marriage, and social status.

name: J.D. Salinger
bio: J.D. Salinger was an American writer known for his novel 'The Catcher in the Rye', which remains one of the most widely read and controversial works in American literature. His writing often explores themes of alienation, identity, and adolescence.
